_meanings:
{@--2@} Anything coming from a cow;
such as milk, flesh, leather &c.
{@--4@} The sign Taurus of the zodiac.

{1} a road or spot 
trodden down by oxen and thus made
impassable. 
{2} the cow's hoof.
{3} the print of a cow's hoof.

{4} a span (from the 

tip of the thumb to that of the
ring-finger).

{5} <ab>N.</ab> of a place of
pilgrimage in the south, sacred to
Śiva; {#SritagokarRaniketamISvaraM#}  
<ls>R. 8. 33.</ls>

{3} <ab>N.</ab> of a village (where Kṛṣṇa
was brought up).

a young cow which has
had only one calf.

the ceremony of offering
a morsel (of grass) to a cow when
performing an expiatory rite.

{2} clarified butter
coming from a cow.

{2} one who
has killed a cow.

{3} one for whom a
cow is killed, a guest.

{3} within
the scope, power, or range of;  
{#avANmanasagocaraM#} <ls>R. 10. 15</ls>; so {#budDi°, dfzwi°#},
{#SravaRa°#} &c.

{2} ({%a%}) a 
district, department, province, sphere.
({%b%}) an abode, dwelling-place.

{3}
range of the organs of sense, an
object of sense; {#SravaRagocare tizWa#} be
within ear-shot; {#nayanagocaraM yA#} to
become visible.

{4} scope, range, in
general; {#harturyAti na gocaraM#} <ls>Bh. 2. 16.</ls>

{7} the range of the 

planets from the Lagna or from
each other. ({#gocarIkf#} to place
within the range of sight, make
current.).

{2} a particular measure of surface
thus defined by Vasiṣṭha:  
--{#daSahastena vaMSena daSavaMSAn samaMtataH . paMca cAByaDikAn#}
{#dadyAdetadgocarma cocyate ..#}.

the tending or feeding of
cows.
the urine of a bull or cow.

{3} a family, race, lineage;
{#gotreRa mAWaro'smi#} <ls>Sk.</ls>; so  
{#kOSikagotrAH, vasizWagotrAH#} &c.; <ls>Ms. 3. 109</ls>,  
<ls n="Ms.">9. 141.</ls>

{9} a road. 10 possessions,
wealth. 11 an umbrella, a parasol.
12 knowledge of futurity. 13
a genus, class, species. 14 a
caste, tribe, caste according to
families.

the
oldest member or founder of a 
family.

blundering or mistaking in calling
(one) by his name, calling by a
wrong name; {#smarasi smara meKalAguREruta#}
{#gAtrasKalitezu baMDanaM#} <ls>Ku. 4. 8.</ls>

armed with
a coat of mail.

{2} the
ceremony of tonsure or cutting the
hair; {#aTAsya godAnaviDeranaMtaraM#}  

<ls>R. 3. 33</ls>; (see Mallinātha's explanation
of the word); {#kftagodAnamaMgalAH#} <ls>U. 1</ls>;
(<ls>Rām.</ls> explains the word 
differently).

{3} the part of the head close
to the right ear.

<ab>N.</ab> of a
river in the south.

the
urine of a bull or cow.

{1} a
herd or multitude of cows, cattle.

the law of cattle, rules 
relating to cattle.

‘dust of
the cows,’ the time of sunset or
evening twilight (so called because
cows, which generally return home
at about sunset, raise up clouds of
dust by their treading on the earth).

an epithet
of the wife of Śiva.

the female
of the Sārasa bird.

{2} an epithet of
Śiva (bellowing like a bull).

an epithet
of Patañjali, author of the 
Mahābhāshya.
the projecting snout of a cow or ox.

{1} a cowherd 
(considered as belonging to a mixed
tribe); {#gopaveSasya vizRoH#} <ls>Me. 15.</ls>

a cowherd's wife (especially 
applied to the cowherdesses of 
Vṛndāvana, the companions of Kṛṣṇa
in his juvenile sports).

the chief of herdsmen,
an epithet of Kṛṣṇa.

the fibrous root 

of a water-lily.

a curved beam which 
supports a thatch.

{3} an
epithet of Śiva; also of Kṛṣṇa.

a holy place, a place
of pilgrimage.

{2} a sort of necklace 
consisting of two or four or thirty-four
strings.

{3} the ornamental gate-way of
a temple.

{2} a place of pilgrimage
on the Sarayū.

the time
when cows return home, sunset or
evening-twilight.

{1} a 
bandage hollowed out so as to fit the
chin or nose &c.

a tractable cow, an 
excellent cow.

<ab>N.</ab> of one of the Mātṛs 
attending on {#kArtikeya#}.

{2} a hole of
a particular shape in a wall made
by thieves.

a cloth-bag
of the shape of a gnomon 
containing a rosary, the beads of which
are counted by the hand thrust 
inside.

the chasm in the 
Himālaya mountains through which
the Ganges flows.

{1} an artificial verse, the second
of which repeats nearly all the
syllables of the first (<ls>Malli.</ls> thus 
defines it: --{#vaMrRAnAmekarUpatvaM yadyekAMtaramarDayoH#}
{#gomUtriketi tatprAhurduzkaraM tadvido viduH ..#} see
<ls>Śi. 19. 46</ls>).

a gem brought from the 
Himālaya and Indus, described as of
four different colours: --white, 
paleyellow, red, and dark-blue.

{3} a
naked man, a mendicant wandering
about without clothes.

a measure of
distance equal to two Krośas.

a bright yellow pigment 
prepared from the urine or bile of a cow,
or found in the head of a cow.

a measure of salt given to
a cow.

a kind of 
monkey with a dark body, red cheeks.
and a tail like that of a cow;  
<ls>Māl. 9. 30.</ls>

a 
celebrated hill in {#vfMdAvana#} the country 
about Mathurā. (This hill was lifted up
and supported by Kṛṣṇa upon one
finger for seven days to shelter the
cowherds from a storm of rain sent
by Indra to test Kṛṣṇa's divinity.’)

the twelfth day in the light half of
the month of {#Palguna#}.

day-break (when
cows are let loose to graze in forests).

<ab>N.</ab> of that portion of the
moon's path which contains the
asterisms {#BAdrapadA, revatI#} and {#aSvinI#}, or
according to some, {#hasta, citrA#} and {#svAtI#}.

one who imitates a cow in
frugality.

a present of a hundred cows to a
Brāhmaṇa.

a kind of 
sacrificelasting for one day.

the time at which cows are 
usually let loose, day-break; see {#govisarga#}.

a kind of cow-sacrifice (not
performed in the Kali age).

<ab>N.</ab>
of two holidays on the fifteenth day 

of the dark half of {#kArtika#} and {#jyezWa#}.

a rope fastened at both
ends having separate halters for
each ox or cow.
